IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ADVANCE ORGANIZATIONAL PERFORMANCE THROUGH EFFECTIVE CONTRACT MANAGEMENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO ADVANCE THE CONTRACT MANAGEMENT PROFESSION THROUGH COMPETENCY ENHANCEMENT, ADVOCACY, AND THE EXECUTION OF PROGRAMS TO CONNECT NCMA MEMBERS AND ENABLE THEIR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT.
IRS990.Desc: ADVERTISING, CREATIVE SERVICES, AND MARKETING - INCLUDES PRODUCING AND PUBLISHING THE MONTHLY MAGAZINE, CONTRACT MANAGEMENT; MAINTAINING THE ASSOCIATION'S WEBSITE; PREPARING PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS FOR ALL THE ASSOCIATION'S ACTIVITIES; AND SUPPORTING THE ASSOCIATION'S JOB BANK AND CAREER SERVICES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CONFERENCES/MEETINGS - INCLUDES THE LARGE-SCALE REGIONAL AND NATIONAL EDUCATIONAL MEETINGS OF THE ASSOCIATION, SUCH AS THE WORLD CONGRESS, GOVERNMENT CONTRACT MANAGEMENT SYMPOSIUM, AND SUBCON TRAINING WORKSHOPS. THESE LARGE-SCALE MEETINGS DIFFER FROM THE CHAPTER HOSTED NATIONAL EDUCATION SEMINARS IN RESPECT OF THE MULTIPLE TRACKS OFFERED, KEYNOTE AND BIG NAME SPEAKERS, AND SOCIAL EVENTS. THESE LARGE-SCALE MEETINGS TAKE PLACE OVER SEVERAL DAYS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND CERTIFICATION - IS COLLECTIVELY KNOWN AS KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT. KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT INCLUDES THE EDUCATIONAL OFFERINGS OF THE ASSOCIATION. INCLUDED IN THIS CATEGORY ARE BOOKS, E-COURSES, WEBINARS, VIRTUAL CONFERENCES, AND NATIONAL EDUCATION SEMINARS THAT ARE HOSTED BY CHAPTERS BASED ON MATERIALS PROVIDED BY THE ASSOCIATION. THE ASSOCIATION ALSO RUNS A LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM CERTIFICATION THAT INCLUDES THE VERIFICATION OF QUALIFICATIONS OF CANDIDATES FOR THE CFCM, CCCM, CPCM AND CCMA CERTIFICATIONS, VERIFICATION OF RECERTIFICATION, AND OVERSEEING THE RELATED EXAMINATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NCMA REPRESENTS THE CONTRACT MANAGEMENT COMMUNITY - ITS MEMBERS, ORGANIZATIONS, AND PRACTICES TO THE PEOPLE AND INSTITUTIONS THAT ARE RELEVANT TO IT. AS PART OF OUR ADVOCACY EFFORTS, WE PROVIDE INFORMATION TO OUR MEMBERS ON ISSUES, TRENDS, LEGISLATIONS, AND REGULATIONS THAT WILL AFFECT THEM AND THEIR ORGANIZATIONS, AND SUBJECT MATTER INFORMATION TO LEGISLATORS, REGULATORS, EMPLOYERS, THE PRESS, AND THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST TO HELP THEM UNDERSTAND THE ISSUES, CHALLENGES, AND OPPORTUNITIES FACING THE CONTRACT MANAGEMENT COMMUNITY. HIGH LEVEL ADVOCACY IS PART OF NCMA'S CORE MISSION, PROVIDED AS PART OF BASIC MEMBERSHIP BENEFITS. NCMA DOES NOT LOBBY - WE DO NOT PROPOSE OR COMMENT ON SPECIFIC LEGISLATION PER SE, BUT WE DO INFORM AND EDUCATE THE PEOPLE THAT SET POLICY OR MAKE RULES UNDER WHICH OUR MEMBERS OPERATE. WE ENCOURAGE MEMBERS TO ENGAGE IN OUR ADVOCACY PROGRAM BY STAYING INFORMED AND PROVIDING FEEDBACK ON ISSUES AND ACTIONS AS THEY OCCUR, PARTICULARLY WITH REGARD TO OUR PROFESSIONAL COMPETENCY BASED "CONTRACT MANAGEMENT BODY OF KNOWLEDGE," WHICH IS A GENERIC MODEL IRRESPECTIVE OF PUBLIC OR PRIVATE CONTRACT MANAGEMENT.

DURING THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, THE ASSOCIATION'S MANAGEMENT DESIGNATED A PORTION OF UNRESTRICTED NET ASSETS TO BE USED FOR FUTURE BUILDING EXPENSES. OTHER ENDOWMENTS CONSIST OF AMOUNTS THAT ARE SUBJECT TO DONOR-IMPOSED TIME OR PURPOSE RESTRICTIONS AND INCOME EARNED ON RESTRICTED NET ASSETS FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ASSOCIATION'S PURPOSE. THE BALANCE REPRESENTS RESOURCES RESTRICTED TO THE INVESTMENT EARNINGS FOR THE BLANCHE WITTE MEMORIAL FOUNDATION ANNUAL REWARD.

NCMA AND CMI HAVE BEEN GRANTED TAX EXEMPTION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE (IRS) FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER 501(C)(6) AND 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. NCMA IS ENTITLED TO RELY ON THIS DETERMINATION AS LONG AS THERE ARE NO MATERIAL CHANGES, INCONSISTENT WITH EXEMPTION, IN THE CHARACTER, PURPOSES, OR METHODS OF OPERATION, OR A CHANGE IN THE APPLICABLE LAW. THE IRS HAS ALSO DETERMINED THAT CMI IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE ASSOCIATION IS SUBJECT TO BOTH FEDERAL AND LOCAL INCOME TAXATION AT CORPORATE TAX RATES ON ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS TAXABLE INCOME. UNRELATED BUSINESS TAX EXPENSE INCURRED WAS $26,027 FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2023. EXEMPTION FROM OTHER TAXES, SUCH AS REAL AND PERSONAL PROPERTY TAXES, IS SEPARATELY DETERMINED. ACCOUNTING STANDARDS REQUIRE RECOGNITION IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR UNCERTAIN INCOME TAX POSITIONS AND DEFINE THE THRESHOLD FOR RECOGNIZING TAX RETURN POSITIONS IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AS "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" THAT THE POSITION IS SUSTAINABLE, BASED ON ITS TECHNICAL MERITS. THE ASSOCIATION HAS DETERMINED THAT IT DOES NOT HAVE ANY MATERIAL UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS OR OBLIGATIONS AS OF JUNE 30, 2023.
NCMA NATIONAL PROVIDES GRANTS TO AFFLIATE CHAPTERS. CHAPTERS PUT TOGETHER A REQUEST AND SUBMIT TO NATIONAL FOR APPROVAL. USE OF THE GRANT IS REVIEWED AS PART OF THE NCMA GROUP 990 DATA COLLECTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CLASSES OF MEMBERSHIP ARE AS FOLLOWS: REGULAR MEMBER, RETIRED MEMBER, ORGANIZATION MEMBER, AFFILIATE MEMBER, STUDENT MEMBER, NEW PROFESSIONAL MEMBER, AND PRO VITA MEMBER. ALL INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS HAVE THE RIGHT TO VOTE AT CHAPTER LEVEL AND HOLD ANY ELECTIVE OFFICE AT THE CHAPTER LEVEL IF ELECTED AND NATIONAL OFFICE IF SELECTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE NOMINATIONS & ELECTIONS COMMITTEE WORKS WITH THE NATIONAL BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO CREATE A LIST OF PROFESSIONAL COMPETENCIES TO BE USED IN THE RECRUITMENT AND CONSIDERATION OF NEW BOARD MEMBERS. THE NOMINATIONS & ELECTIONS COMMITTEE WILL IDENTIFY AND SOLICIT POTENTIAL CANDIDATES FOR BOARD ELECTION AS DIRECTOR. AT THE SPRING BOARD MEETING, THE COMMITTEE WILL PRESENT A REPORT DETAILING THE NOMINEES AND A VOTE WILL BE TAKEN TO ELECT NEW BOARD MEMBERS. FOR COMMITTEE MEMBER ASSIGNMENTS THE BOARD REQUESTS INTERESTED MEMBERS TO SUBMIT A STATEMENT OF INTEREST THAT IS USED DURING THE MEMBER ELECTION PROCESS TO INFORM MEMBERS OF THE QUALIFICATIONS OF MEMBERS INTERESTED IN BECOMING COMMITTEE MEMBERS. MEMBERS WILL VOTE FOR CANDIDATES TO FILL THE OPEN COMMITTEE POSITIONS. THE CANDIDATES RECEIVING THE MOST VOTES ARE ELECTED TO FILL THE NUMBER OF VACANT POSITIONS AVAILABLE. FOR EXAMPLE, IF THERE ARE FOUR VACANCIES, THE FOUR CANDIDATES RECEIVING THE MOST VOTES ARE ELECTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN THE CASE OF DISSOLUTION OF THE ASSOCIATION ONLY. IN SUCH A CASE A PROPOSAL SHALL BE PRESENTED TO THE ASSOCIATION MEMBERSHIP FOR RATIFICATION BY AN AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF MORE THAN TWO THIRDS OF ALL VOTES CAST BY THE MEMBERS AT A MEMBERSHIP MEETING WHERE A QUORUM EXISTS (ONE TENTH OF THE TOTAL NUMBER OF MEMBERS).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ONCE THE RETURN IS PREPARED IT IS REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT AND RISK COMMITTEE. IF THERE ARE NO CHANGES THE RETURN IS MADE AVAILABLE TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR 10 BUSINESS DAYS. IF THERE ARE NO COMMENTS THE RETURN IS APPROVED FOR FILING AS A PART OF THE CONSENT AGENDA AT THE DECEMBER BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS REQUIRED TO BE SIGNED ANNUALLY BY ALL BOARD MEMBERS. ANY CONFLICT OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT IS REQUIRED TO BE DISCLOSED TO THE PRESIDENT IN WRITING VIA THE CEO. NCMA PROVIDES ANNUAL BOARD TRAINING TO NEW AND EXISTING MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CEO COMPENSATION: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE DETERMINES THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO BASED ON COMPARABILITY DATA AND INPUT FROM BOARD MEMBERS. COMPARABILITY DATA USED INCLUDES SURVEYS OF NOT FOR PROFIT CEO SALARIES. THE PROCESS IS DOCUMENTED IN THE FORM OF AN EMAIL FROM THE PAST PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD TO THE CEO AND THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER. OTHER OFFICERS AND/OR KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY, AND COMPENSATION IS BASED ON COMPARABILITY DATA AND INPUT FROM THE CEO. COMPARABILITY USED INCLUDES SALARY RANGES BASED UPON DATA FOR SIMILAR NOT FOR PROFIT POSITIONS IN THE MARKETPLACE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL STATEMENTS HELD AT NCMA HQ ARE AVAILABLE FOR INSPECTION BY THE PUBLIC AT ALL TIMES. OTHER DOCUMENTS MAY BE REVIEWED BY MEMBERS IN GOOD STANDING AND SOME OF THESE DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE NCMA WEBSITE AND THEREFORE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC VIEWING FOR THE SAME PERIOD OF DISCLOSURE AS SET FORTH IN SECTION 6104(D).
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED SINCE THE PRIOR YEAR.
